jbt.execution.context
Class BasicContext

java.lang.Object
  jbt.execution.context.BasicContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
IContext
Direct Known Subclasses:
HierarchicalContext
public class BasicContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements IContext

Basic implementation of the IContext interface. This class uses a Hashtable to store the set of variables.

Also, since a context must contain a set of behaviour trees, this class defines some methods to add behaviour trees to the context.

Author:
Ricardo Juan Palma Dur√°n

setVariable

public boolean setVariable(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.Object value)
Description copied from interface: IContext
Sets the value of a variable. If the variable already existed, its value is overwritten. value may be null in order to clear the value of the variable.

Specified by:
setVariable in interface IContext
Parameters:
name - the name of the variable.
value - the value for the variable.
Returns:
true if a variable with the same name already existed, and false otherwise.

clearVariable

public boolean clearVariable(java.lang.String name)
Description copied from interface: IContext
Clears the value of a variable. This is equivalent to calling IContext.setVariable(String, Object) with a value of null for the second argument.

Specified by:
clearVariable in interface IContext
Parameters:
name - the name of a variable.
Returns:

See Also:
IContext.clearVariable(java.lang.String)

addBTLibrary

public boolean addBTLibrary(IBTLibrary library)
Adds all the behaviour trees in library to the set of behaviour trees stored in the context. If there is already a tree with the same name as that of one of the trees in library, it is overwritten.

Parameters:
library - the library containing all the behaviour trees to add to this context.
Returns:
true if a previously stored behaviour tree has been overwritten, and false otherwise.

addBT

public boolean addBT(java.lang.String name,
                     ModelTask tree)
Adds the behaviour tree tree to the set of behaviour trees stored in the context. If there is already a tree with the name name, then it is overwritten by tree.

Parameters:
name - the name that will identify the tree tree in the context.
tree - the tree to insert.
Returns:
true if there was already a tree with name name, and false otherwise.

getBT

public ModelTask getBT(java.lang.String name)
Description copied from interface: IContext
Returns the behaviour tree whose name is name, or null in case it does not exist it the context.

Specified by:
getBT in interface IContext
Parameters:
name - the name of the tree to retrieve.
Returns:
the root of the behaviour tree whose name is name, or null in case it does not exist in the context.
See Also:
IContext.getBT(java.lang.String)
